author: Sam Goldfarb
title: Junk Bonds Withstand Headwinds
text:
The market for riskier corporate bonds is picking up again, showing the resilience of investor appetite for high-yielding junk debt in the face of rising Treasury yields, large fund outflows and volatility in stocks.
After two months of negative returns, bonds rated speculative grade, or “junk,” by credit-rating firms have returned 0.6% in April, counting price changes and interest payments, according to Bloomberg Barclays data, compared with negative 1.3% for investment-grade bonds.
